document_title: Congenital pectus excavatum in children: Causes, symptoms, diagnosis
subsection_content:
Mild chest depression often has no symptoms and does not affect health. However, if left untreated, depending on the severity of the disease, it will cause pain due to bone deformation, muscle tension or cardiopulmonary compression, pushing the heart to the left side of the chest and reducing the ability to pump blood effectively, affecting the heart. children's physical activity.
Not only does it cause loss of aesthetics, this deformity also significantly affects the physiology of children, especially older children, causing them to lack confidence, slow development, and hesitate to communicate. (3)
